text: David Allan Evans (born 1940 Sioux City, Iowa) USA is an American poet. From 2002 to 2014, he was the poet laureate of the U.S. state of South Dakota.David Allan Evans The Man in the Rendering Room by David Allan Evans Betty L. Beer - David Allan Evans, Poet Laureate of South Dakota ==Life== He attended college on a football scholarship and earned degrees from Morningside College, the University of Iowa, and the University of Arkansas with a M.F.A. in creative writing. Since 1968, Evans has taught at South Dakota State University where he is a Professor of English and a Writer-in-Residence. Evans has published five books of poetry. ==Awards== He received two grants as a Fulbright Scholar to study in China, and was the first South Dakotan to receive a grant from the National Endowment for the Arts in 1974. ==References== https://www.poetryfoundation.org/poets/david-allan-evans ==External links== *Website at South Dakota State University * Interview with a Poet: David Allan Evans Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:21st-century American poets Category:Poets from Iowa Category:Poets from South Dakota Category:Poets Laureate of South Dakota Category:20th-century American poets Category:Morningside College alumni Category:University of Iowa alumni Category:University of Arkansas alumni Category:South Dakota State University faculty
